org.javacogs
Class StrUtil

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.javacogs.StrUtil
public final class StrUtil
extends java.lang.Object

StrUtil provides utility methods for manipulating strings and string buffers.

Author:
Thornton Rose

booleanValue

public static boolean booleanValue(java.lang.String str)
Gets the boolean value of the given string, such that the string "true", ignoring case, => true. Anything else => false.
Parameters:

sb - Buffer to fill.
c - Character to replicate.
n - Number of times to replicate c.
Returns:
StringBuffer that contains n copies of c.

replicate

public static java.lang.StringBuffer replicate(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                                               java.lang.String str,
                                               int n)
Replicate the given string n times into the given buffer.
Parameters:
sb - Buffer to fill.
str - String to replicate.
n - Number of times to replicate str.
Returns:
StringBuffer that contains n copies of str.

wordWrap

public static java.lang.String wordWrap(java.lang.String str,
                                        int width)
Wrap the given string at the given width on word boundaries. The line terminator is '\n'. Any line formatting using '\n' in the given string is preserved.
Parameters:
str - String to wrap.
width - Width at which to wrap string.
Returns:
Wrapped string.

split

public static java.lang.String[] split(java.lang.String str,
                                       java.lang.String delimiter)
Split a string into an array of strings.

Example:
s1 = "A,B" split(s1, ",") => { "A", "B" }
Parameters:
str - String to split.
delimiter - Delimiter on which to split the string.
Returns:
Array of strings.

join

public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.String[] arr,
                                    java.lang.String delimiter)
Create a delimited string from an array of strings.

Example:
a1 = { "A", "B" } join(a1, ",") => "A,B"
Parameters:
arr - Array of strings to join.
delimiter - Delimiter between strings.
Returns:
Delimited string.

merge

public static java.lang.String merge(java.lang.String[] arr1,
                                     java.lang.String[] arr2,
                                     java.lang.String pairDelim,
                                     java.lang.String strDelim)
Create a delimited string that contains pairs of delimited strings from two arrays.

Example:
a1 = { "A", "B" } a2 = { "1", "2" } merge(a1, a2, "=", ",") => "A=1,B=2"
Parameters:
arr1 - First array of strings to merge.
arr2 - Second array of strings to merge.
pairDelim - Delimiter between strings of each pair.
strDelim - Delimiter between strings.
Returns:
Delimited string.

hexEncode

public static java.lang.String hexEncode(java.lang.String str)
Encodes the given string as a series of hexadecimal values delimited with colons. (This method is useful for converting an encrypted string to printable form.)

Example:

ABC --> 41:42:43
Parameters:
str - The string to be encoded.
See Also:
hexDecode(String)

hexEncode

public static java.lang.StringBuffer hexEncode(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
Encodes the given string buffer as a series of hexadecimal values delimited with colons.

Example:

ABC --> 41:42:43
Parameters:
sb - The buffer to be encoded.

hexDecode

public static java.lang.String hexDecode(java.lang.String str)
Decodes a string from another string that contains a series of hexadecimal values delimited with colons. Unrecognized tokens are converted to '?'.

Examples:

41:42:43 --> ABC
41:zz:43 --> A?C
Parameters:
str - The string to be decoded.

hexDecode

public static java.lang.StringBuffer hexDecode(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
Decodes a buffer that contains a series of hexadecimal values delimited with colons. Unrecognized tokens are converted to '?'.

Examples: 

 41:42:43 --> ABC

 41:zz:43 --> A?C
Parameters:
sb - The buffer to be decoded.
